name: IEEE YP, Volunteering Platform and Career management for YPs
description: This talk will share highlights of IEEE YP committee goals and initiatives, how YPs can enhance their careers and IEEE Volunteering platform.
instructordescription: Emre Ayranci is currently an RFIC Design manager and principal engineer at pSemi Murata. He is the IEEE Young Professionals Committee chair and SSCS Secretary/ Governance Chair. He was the SSCS YP Committee Chair, IEEE YP Vice Chair, Benelux YP and Professional activities Chair and founder of DTU and Sabanci University IEEE Student Branch.

name: The importance of certification in career development
description:
- The certification as a skills validation way at the international level
- Skills technology market demand
- Alignment with international benchmarks of excellence
- Career paths and design
- Promote your ( employee/employer) brand in the marketplace
- Clevory ACADEMY: a new fast-track training model with compressed programs that aim to make certification more widely available to the general public for international recognition 
- Clevory ACADEMY is your gateway to certification for more Job opportunities
instructordescription:
Senior IT Professional with an Executive MBA degree and fourteen years
experience in Enterprise and SP industry including four years as an Account
Manager for Cisco.
instructorhighlight: CEO of Clevory Training, an IT, Telco & Business Skills Traning Company
instructor2description: Consultant and Trainer in Network and Security, Virtualization and Automation and an IT Engineer: TEK-UP university.
instructor2highlight:
Consultant and Trainer Cisco & VMware/ Audit, Design and Integration of network
and data Center Solutions

name:
Internet of Things and real-time
computing
description:
We live in a data-driven world, where multiple devices around us measure all
kind of physical magnitudes and communicate to each other. In order to be
useful, these devices must be able to operate in real time. The talk will
provide an introduction on the constraints that real time computing present
for IoT devices and will describe real-time operating systems and what we can
expect from them.
instructordescription: Antonio Luque is the IEEE Region 8 Director elected in 2019. He currently holds the position of Associate Professor in the Department of Electronics Engineering, University of Seville. He has authored 20 journal papers, 40 conference papers, 3 book chapters, and a textbook, in addition to supervising two PhD students.

name: Healthcare Innovation and Entrepreneurship
description:
The aim of this course is to provide an intensive and practical introduction to the process
of understanding significant unmet medical needs and designing new medical
technologies to address them. We focus on strategies for understanding and interpreting
clinical needs, performing market assessments, and designing two basic prototypes in the
areas of Cancer Brain Chip and Implantable Brain System
instructordescription: Metin Akay received his B.S. and M.S. in Electrical Engineering from the Bogazici University, Istanbul, Turkey in 1981 and 1984, respectively and a Ph.D. degree from Rutgers University in 1990. He is currently the founding chair of the new Biomedical Engineering Department and the John S. Dunn professor of biomedical engineering at the University of Houston.

name: Managing a career along with a successful volunteering journey
description: This keynote will focus on the importance of volunteering and how it is considered as a career booster at work, what you learn as a volunteer and how to use that knowledge at in life and at work,  how to chose your volunteering activities to support your professional development as leader and manager and of course how volunteering makes you a better manager and leader
instructordescription:
Margaretha Eriksson received her M.Sc. degree in Electrical Engineering from The Royal
Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden, in 1988. She has studied Information
Security at Stockholm University/KTH, as well as Business Intelligence. She became the first female Director of IEEE R8 in 2017.

name: How do we stay technically current?
description: This interactive keynote session will focus on value of IEEE membership and explains the real benefits to students and young professional from being the member of IEEE. The presentation gives a short overview of the membership and technical/chapter activities; the actual status and the regional characteristics of the membership and chapter development will be demonstrated.  In addition, it will cover best practices in organizing and running successful chapters.
instructordescription: Dr.sc.ing., MBA, Associate Professor and Senior Researcher at the Information Technology Institute, Head of Dept. of Modelling and Simulation, Riga Technical University . He has 20 years academic experiences teaching numerous post-graduate courses at the RTU, as well as over 30 years professional experience .
instructorhighlight: Chair, IEEE Region 8 Chapter Cordination Committee
instructor2description: Mike Hinchey is Professor of Software Engineering at University of Limerick, Ireland. Prior to joining Lero, he was Director of the NASA Software Engineering Laboratory; he continues to serve as a NASA Expert. He is also Editor-in-Chief of Innovations in Systems and Software Engineering: a NASA Journal and Journal of the Brazilian Computer Society.
instructor2highlight: Chair, IEEE Region 8 Membership Development Committee

name: EMBS Chapter/Membership Opportunities for Students and YPs
description:
IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBS) is the world’s largest
international society of biomedical engineers. This talk will introduce the technical
communities and events organized within EMBS, then focus on:
- benefits of becoming a member for students and YPs, volunteering opportunities
through Members and Student Activities Committee
- how to establish a student chapter/club within EMBS, and benefits such as funding,
awards, distinguished lecturer program etc.
instructordescription: Andre Cakici is currently an M.Sc. student at the Department of Medical Engineering, Friedrich-Alexander Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg. He served as a student representative at EMBS Turkey Chapter. He is currently the AdCom Student Representative for the IEEE engineering in Medicine and Biology Society.

name: Getting Involved with IEEE: How does it help Students and Young Professionals?
description:
Every one of us wants to get a successful career. While we select diverse paths to achieve that goal, we all need resources that help us develop personally, professionally, 
and technically. Those resources include building a network of successful people, accessing the latest updates in our field of expertise, and being equipped with the tools to deliver our work 
to others. In this keynote, I will highlight how IEEE brings all of these resources to us. Then, I will give key points to achieve our goals when volunteering with IEEE. Last, but not least, I open 
the floor for students and Young Professionals for a discussion where all of us can interact, ask questions, and learn from each other.
instructordescription: Dr. Bouida is a Senior Researcher and a Cisco Chair Technical Manager at the IOT Lab at Carleton University, Ottawa, Canada. He is a Senior Member of the IEEE, HKN Professional Member, and a professional Engineer in Ontario. He served as IEEE Qatar YPs Committee Chair in 2016 and as IEEE Canada (R7) YPs Committee Chair from 2017 to 2021.
instructorhighlight: Former IEEE Region 7 YPs Committee Chair

name: Number One Marketplace in Tunisia
description: Since its creation in 2012, Tayara's mission is to facilitate the daily life of Tunisians and support their various life projects. Affiliated to Frontier Digital Ventures (FDV) and leader in the automotive, real estate and retail markets, Tayara is now positioned as the largest marketplace in Tunisia and a major player in the digital ecosystem in Tunisia. This talk will introduce and then will focus on: - history of tayara - their mission - Tayara's services and products - their Talents.
instructordescription: Safa is the Head of Operations of Tayara. As an experienced Tech training Program Manager & Coach and a history of working in the information technology and services industry, Safa is contributing in making Tayara a home for young innovative talents who have a passion for game changing products

name: IEEE Region 8 Pitch Final 2022
description: IEEE Region 8 Pitch is the flagship program of IEEE Region 8 Entrepreneurship. After 10+ national pitch competitions in 2021, and 30+ startups competing, 5 made it to the fina! Startups pitching are: FeelMe from Greece, Greeners from Palestine, EFert from UAE, LangSmart from Palestine, and Noisure from Georgia. Join us to learn more about their ventures in agri-tech, bio-tech and AI, and connect with our judges from IEEE, RedStart Tunisia Accelerator, Founder Institute Tunisia, and Oxfam.

name: Digital transformation and its economic impact
description:
- Core technology trends that make Digital transformation possible.
- Barriers to Digital Transformation
- Digital transformation phases and approach 
- Technologies to consider to reach Strategic Objectives
instructordescription:
Senior IT Professional with an Executive MBA degree and fourteen years’
experience in Enterprise and SP industry including four years as an Account
Manager for Cisco.
instructorhighlight: CEO of Clevory Training, an IT, Telco & Business Skills Traning Company

name: 2022 MGA Activities with a Spotlight on Students and Young Professionals
description: 2022 has been a productive year thus far for IEEE's Member and Geographic Activities (MGA) organization. MGA Vice President David Koehler and IEEE's Senior Director of Member Experience, Michael Kreisberg will highlight current MGA data and trends, focusing on Region 8.  They will share some of the exciting programs and activities that are impacting our Student and Young Professional member growth.  In addition, they will provide an overview of the MGA volunteer organizational structure and share the pathways that volunteers can take to enhance their engagement with IEEE.
instructordescription: Distinguished career providing vision, strategy, and leadership for blue chip organizations in both the for-profit and association . Recognized for building, leading, and mobilizing cross-functional, multi-disciplinary teams around an aspirational vision. Skilled in working closely with Boards, volunteers and senior leadership.
instructor2description: David is the 2022 Vice President for IEEE Member and Geographic Activities (MGA).He is the Global Business Development Manager for Doble Engineering Company.David has 23 years of experience in the testing of insulating liquids and management of analytical laboratories.  He has provided numerous technical presentations and published articles within the power industry.
instructor2highlight: IEEE Vice President, Member and Geographic Activities

name: HAC Capacity Building workshop
description: This session will present various global programs offered by HAC and the best practices for the design and development of the IEEE HAC/SIGHT sustainable development program.  This workshop will focus on how emerging technologies offer a transformative opportunity to address pressing global sustainable development challenges. We will discuss real-world examples of sustainable technologies that are relevant to achieving the Sustainable Development Goals. We will explore how IEEE Humanitarian Activities Committee (IEEE HAC) offers high-impact engagement opportunities for IEEE members to advance technologies for the benefit of marginalized communities globally.  The audience will have an opportunity to network and learn about the successfully implemented  HAC  projects,
instructordescription: Sampathkumar Veeraraghavan is a globally renowned technologist best known for his technological innovations in addressing global humanitarian and sustainable development challenges. As the 2021-2022 IEEE Humanitarian Activities Committee (HAC) Global Chair, Sampath spearheads the global strategy and has delivered record-breaking growth for IEEE  sustainable development and humanitarian engineering programs globally.
instructorhighlight: Global Chair, 2021 - 2022 IEEE Humanitarian Activities Committee
instructor2description: Abdullateef has over 15 years experience working in the information and communication technology (ICT) /Telecommunication industry focusing on providing broadband services to the urban and rural areas in Nigeria and across West Africa; he heads the infrastructure roll-out and deployment department in Phase 3 telecom.
instructor2highlight: Chair, IEEE R8 Humanitarian Activities Committee

name: Building a Resilient Future
description:
The wide adoption of Information Technology by modern business and public space removes the boundaries between real and virtual worlds and enables new growth possibilities for the industry and society. During the last decades, the business world has experienced a massive digital transformation. Drones, cloud computing, artificial intelligence, self-driving cars, nanotechnology, commercial space activities, robotics are very few examples of exponentially growing technologies, that are revolutionary changing the business models, industrial and societal processes fundamentally. From the other side, the influx of online traffic as a result of the Covid pandemic strains already rigid legacy systems, resulting in outages and service delays. Along with tragic losses of human life, the economic and social impacts of the pandemic could last for an extended period, even decades in some countries. Resilience is critical to softening the impacts of such shocks on businesses, individuals, communities and countries.

Two aspects of modern recilience challenging will be discussed at the Workshops, Building Resilient Space Exploration Missions by Mike Hinchey and Building Resilient Supply Chains by Andrejs Romanovs.
instructorhighlight: Chair, IEEE Region 8 Membership Development Committee
instructordescription: Mike Hinchey is Professor of Software Engineering at University of Limerick, Ireland. Prior to joining Lero, he was Director of the NASA Software Engineering Laboratory; he continues to serve as a NASA Expert. He is also Editor-in-Chief of Innovations in Systems and Software Engineering: a NASA Journal and Journal of the Brazilian Computer Society.
instructor2description: Dr.sc.ing., MBA, Associate Professor and Senior Researcher at the Information Technology Institute, Head of Dept. of Modelling and Simulation, Riga Technical University . He has 20 years academic experiences teaching numerous post-graduate courses at the RTU, as well as over 30 years professional experience .
instructor2highlight: Chair, IEEE Region 8 Chapter Cordination Committee

name: Student Branch Vitality Workshop
description: Vitality means performing your duties efficiently, taking initiatives, being energetic, and volunteering with enthusiasm. Vital student branches can better serve their student members. In order to have all Student Branches alive, the IEEE Region 8 Student Activities Committee provides a workshop on the critical areas for being characterized as active and on how to maintain your operations at an exemplary level.

name: Project Management for Student-driven Events
description: This is an introductory workshop for project management focused on student-driven events. Nowadays, everything is a project, and especially students should be taught about the required skills to handle projects and succeed. Participants will be able to gain an overall understanding about project management and get familiar of how to prepare their project proposals, how to support the planning, as well as how to implement and conclude their projects in their student branch. By the end of the workshop, participants will be able to prepare their own project plan to submit on the IEEE Region 8 Student Activities Committee Programs!

name: Energy Transition and Renewable Energy as a Young Professional
description: In the path toward net-zero, young professionals will play a crucial role in deploying and developing renewable energy for this transition. What does this mean in terms of the significant growth in green jobs and how can YPs look back at the 2020 - 2030 decade from 2050 and realise the implications of the actions we took?
instructordescription: AbdulHameed has over 3 years of experience in the Energy sector, working with General Electric, Masdar Energy and Resilient Cities Network.  He is researching how to strengthen policies for the low-carbon transition at the University of Cambridge.
instructorhighlight: Engineering for Sustainable Development at University of Cambridge

name:
Introduction to Neuromuscular Interfaces: Applications for Human/Machine 
Interfaces and Neurophysiology
description:
The aim of this Workshops is to provide an intensive and practical introduction to 
neuromuscular interfaces and neuroengineering applications for studying the neural 
control of movement and developing human-centered assistive devices (e.g. 
neuroprostheses, exoskeletons). The acquisition, analysis, and interpretation of 
electrophysiological data (specifically electromyography - EMG) will be discussed in 
depth. A MATLAB demo will demonstrate the decomposition and processing of 
surface EMG signal. State-of-the-art research will be mentioned, and resources will 
be provided for those interested in this technical field.
instructordescription: Andre Cakici is currently an M.Sc. student at the Department of Medical Engineering, Friedrich-Alexander Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg. He served as a student representative at EMBS Turkey Chapter. He is currently the AdCom Student Representative for the IEEE engineering in Medicine and Biology Society.

name: Introduction to ERP and SAP
description: How you gather, manage, and use information will determine whether you win or lose.
instructordescription: Seif El HAJJEM is a Tunisian Industrial Engineer graduated from ENIT, the National Engineering School of Tunis, in 2015. Currently, he's an SAP (System Application Products) Functional Consultant at WYNSYS Tunisia, where he has been involved in the roll-out and implementation of SAP for multiple companies in different industry sectors. Seif volunteers for IEEE, where he is currently serving as IEEE Tunisia Section Vice-Chair for members activities, as a Member of the IEEE Region 8 Young Professionals Subcommittee and as a Vice Chair of the IEEE Region 8 Entrepreneurship Initiative Subcommittee.

name: Advanced Corrosion monitoring systems
description: In the evolution of inspection programs, the fixed interval inspection strategy has been replaced by a condition-based monitoring approach. Condition-based monitoring is followed by risk-based inspection (RBI), where inspection programs are defined on a risk basis, considering damage mechanisms, failure probability and associated consequences. The use of new inspection technologies such as PAUT, TOFD, Remote Operated Vehicles (ROV) and Intelligent Pigging Inspection, etc. was able to make informed decisions regarding the remaining life of pressure systems and pipelines. In this Workshops, you will learn about advances in corrosion monitoring technologies. We will highlight how these new technologies can help provide the most effective data to manage and mitigate potential pressure vessels and pipelines integrity risks.
instructordescription: Aymen Tmar is a Tunisian electromechanical engineer, who is currently an asset Integrity Engineer at Shell. He was the Chairman of IEEE PES ENIS Student Branch Chapter in 2014 and occupied the position of IEEE Tunisia Young Professionals AG chairman in 2019. He is currently the chair of IEEE IAS Tunisia Section chapter.

name: Introduction to cybersecurity
description: In this Workshops we will explore the fundamental building blocks of cybersecurity and the most recent techniques used by red teamers and offensive security experts along with the most important resources to start your career in Cyber Security.
instructordescription: Ahmed Belkahla is Studying Computer Science & Networks Engineering at the National Institute of Applied Science and Technology (INSAT) and is a Cyber Security Specialist at Yogosha. He occupied the position of vice chairman of Securinets and was the Media manager of IEEE CS INSAT Chapter in 2019.

name: Hawkar's success story
description:
Khadija, CEO of HawKar, with more than 5 years of experience in team leadership, project management, sales, and marketing in the automotive field. A disabled person who has always struggled to be independent and who decided to solve the mobility problem of disabled people. Being in a wheelchair did not prevent her from being active in life. She has set herself a mission to make the freedom of mobility accessible to all.
Has been selected and recognized in 2020 by the Meaningful Business 100 among outstanding leaders across the world combining profit and purpose to help achieve the UN Sustainable Development Goals."
instructordescription: Khadija Jallouli is the founder of HawKar. She was selected by the Meaningful Business 100 among outstanding leaders across the world combining profit and purpose to help achieve the UN Sustainable Development Goals. She graduated from the National Institute of Applied science and technologies (INSAT) in 2020.

name: Personal Branding
instructor2highlight: Marketing and Talent Acquisition Expert DRÄXLMAIER Tunisia

name: Industry 4.0: Enabling Intelligence and secure automotive ecosystem
IEEE CS Talk
description: Learn all about IEEE Computer Society opportunities explained, key moments, events and how to evolve .
instructordescription: N/A

name: How to start your Tech Startup?
description: The workshop will give you briefly how to start a tech-based startup  from Ideation to getting into the market
instructordescription:
Mohamed El Dallal is a serial Entrepreneur currently the Co-founder & CEO of "Techne" and Co-founder & CEO "Of Innovideas LLC. for Marketing & Advertising".
He has conducted hundreds of Talks/ Panels /workshops in 30+ countries about his Entrepreneurship, Marketing, and business development. In addition, he works as a lecturer at the AAST University as well as working on Marketing & offering Business Consultations for Egyptian SMEs and mentoring Startups over the EMEA region.

name: Preparing yourself for a successful career
description: IEEE offers various employment and career opportunities for students and professionals from the engineering and technology sectors. IEEE looks to promote career progression among engineers and technical professionals from a variety of disciplines. IEEE Region 8 Action for Industry offers to members mentoring and internships at various industry corporations of different sizes and sectors. At the Career fair you can learn about internship positions secured by IEEE, collaboration of IEEE with various industry corporations and mentoring of members who work in industry, entrepreneurs, YPs and students. In addition the presenters will share anecdotes of how to position yourself for a successful career.
instructordescription: Kithinji is a skilled, passionate, and interested in electronics & software engineering projects, emerging technologies (AI & IoT), their applications, and people interactions with the ability to work in teams or independently by applying design thinking, problem-solving, critical and analytical thinking. He is also an AFI subcomitte member.
instructor2description: Result driven and result oriented leader in technology and communication. Key interest areas are ICT, circular economy, AI, Data Analytics, Cloud, IoT and entrepreneurship. Want to contribute to the improvement of humanity through nonprofit technology activities.
instructor3description: John Matogo is the Global University Programs Leader for IBM Africa. John joined IBM in Sept 2014 bringing with him vast experience from the academic community in East Africa. His role involves leading IBM academic programmes with universities in countries in the African region. He is an active volunteer with IEEE in Region 8 (EMEA region) and is serving as the current Chair for the Action for Industry sub-committee in Region 8. (EMEA region).

name: Building successful Career
description: We are all thinking about our current and future job. Join us to know how IEEE can support you in building a successful career.
instructordescription: MEA Digital Transformation Sales Lead in Nokia. He was selected as IEEE Industry Ambassador IEEE Region 8 (EMEA) in January 2015.

name: Smart Buildings - Forging the Foundations of Smart Cities
description: none
instructordescription:
Sohaib Sheikh is a senior ICT and Smart Buildings professional with multidisciplinary, cross-sector, global consultancy experience. He has expertise in strategy, design, implementation, and commissioning of large-scale complex systems on major international capital investment programs, particularly in the commercial property and sports sectors across the United Kingdom, Middle East, and Russia. He currently works at Landsec, a FTSE100 Real Estate Investment Trust in the UK where he tackles challenges relating to technology in the built environment and smart buildings.

Sheikh has previously delivered keynotes and workshops at 40+ international events including the UNESCO World Science Forum, IEEE Sections Congress, and the World Engineering Education Forum.

name: Talent First
description:
Talent Acquisition management and development our main focus within DRÄXLMAIER Group and grows as a vital functions in our industry, building and nurturing the best talent community, leading the workforce of the future.
A Glance on the different programs and strategies toward talent community from a very early stage to ensure appropriate career development and management according to their aspirations.
instructordescription:
8 years of experience in the HR field with the purpose to empower people, and to drive a new talent acquisition and development culture. Bringing his capacities and experience of different HRD topics, Personal Marketing, and business to contribute to the success of the organization and to engage with and influence people with different skill sets and mindsets who come from different backgrounds and levels.
“Building and nurturing the best talent community, leading the workforce of the future”
instructorhighlight: Head of Head of Personal Marketing & Talent Acquisition DRÄXLMAIER Tunisia

name: How to Pitch your Startup !
description: Reflections on how to take a rise from a boring set of slides to a complete experience that inspires and impresses your audience.
instructordescription: Ghazi Saddem is an Organizational Management and Digital Transformation Consultant. He has accompanied many Startups in Tunisia, in the Mediterranean region, in the MENA region and in sub-Saharan Africa. Ghazi is currently a mentor within the Seedstars Mentor Hub
